Maybe you should swap out that completely bland bourbon cherry and replace it with Tangy Tangerine.  Anyway, won't be back.  Still on the hunt for GREAT/GOOD gelato.
author: Edyn O.

description: Creamy, yummy and delicious. Delicious, creamy and yummy. Yummy, delicious and creamy. No matter how you put it this place is good, I love it that I live in such a cool neighborhood and this place only makes the neighborhood even sweeter.
author: Troy R.

description: While I don't sense the commitment to quality ingredients, like you'll get at Naia, Milano, or Tango, I love Gelato Classico. I'll bet they add some thickening agent to the gelato, because this is the gooiest ice cream on the planet. The dark chocolate and the espresso are sublime by themselves or even better together; vanilla bean, hazelnut, and straciatella are also strong choices. Sorbettos are okay - stick to the gelato. More flavors would be welcome, but I'm always happy with the classics.
author: Andy M.

description: Always good, but expensive for such a tiny cup.  Cute shop, and they serve hot tea, too.  I kinda like that combo, a cup of hot tea and a cup of frozen delight.  But next to the cup of tea, my cup of gelato looks even smaller.  Patience, i keep saying, patience... damn it sweet tooth, heel damn it.
author: Today Y.

description: I love gelato so much that I spent my remaining $3 in change, set aside for bus fare home, on a cup of chocolate mint upon my lucky discovery of this place.  I thought of it more as a double bonus:  get to enjoy some amazing gelato AND walk off the calories by the time I'd reached my front door.  I think I also made everyone I passed on the street jealous.  And  hungry.
author: Kate M.

description: This has the best gelato in the neighborhood.  Not only does it have the standard, American-style, chocolate and vanilla flavors, but the traditional Italian fruit flavors.  I love finding apricot, or pomegranite or mango on a hot day.  No (or, rather, limited - I think there is about three chairs) seating and cash only.  And don't forget to get the punch card next time!
author: Sarah R.

description: Um, excuse me, creme Brule gelato....are you f-ing kidding me? hey, hey, hey! so freaking amazing. I didn't used to be a big gelato eater. I was more into the un-stringy ice cream of yore, but Gelato Classico Italian has perfected making the flavors of my dreams in the consistency of the heavens. Yes, cliche's galore, I know, but the word gelato didn't mean a damn thing to me before this bitch. Oh ya! Way better then Naia, just up the street. Naia tastes alright, but it's just a plain old Jane compared to Classico. Like comparing Jell-O with, um, well, Creme freaking Brule! Which Classico has! Yum...going tomorrow, who gives a flying swan fuck if it's raining.
author: Sammy S.

description: I had a small cup with Spumoni and Tiramisu and I loved it, really great flavors, chunks of ladyfingers in the ice cream, more than I could ask for.  The only thing I had a little trouble with was that the lady working there wasn't overly friendly, and this was the first time I've had gelato in the states so I was a little surprised by the price, $3.50 for a small cup.  Good stuff though.
author: Asha H.

description: Excellent! Have seen photos on yelp, but it seems that they have remodeled. Good flavor choices - too many good ones to pick from. We got two small cups. One had half Strawberry Cheesecake and half Tiramusui. The other cup had half Cappuccino and half Coppa Mista. Both cups were delicious!! Highly recommended. But too bad no inside seating...only had one small bench in front of parlor. Overall, great family owned gelato shop.!
author: Lisa C.

description: They supply the gelato i like but i dont know the companys name. Powells sweet shop in burlingame supplies the same brand too...but its yummy! i looooove love love the bavarian mint. omg theres nothing like it. shop is super small about the size of my closet. i dont remember the prices but it wasnt expensive.
author: Ame C.

description: Food fit for Zeus himself, but the only way you can eat the ice "dream" here is to have worked out 20 years consectutively and not a single piece of junk food can go into your mouth, then and only then may you eat from this place because 1 gelatto will give you the fats
author: Jimmy K.

description: Rich, creamy and delicious. This gelato place turned my sweaty day into a relaxing mellow day. I was in heaven when I had the cherry flavored one. =]
author: Jason C. J.

description: By far the best gelato I've had in the city!  Its North Beach location is great if you have dinner in the area beforehand and want a quick dessert nearby.  Service is friendly and the gelato is creamy, maintains a consistent texture, and fresh.  There is also an ample selection, ranging from low fat sorbets to different kinds of gelatos.  Try the tiramisu or chocolate/hazelnut flavors for a gelato delight, and enjoy it nearby in Washington Square Park!
author: Megha S.

description: OMFG this place is amazing. The Bavarian Mint and Dark Chocolate combo are literally to die for. Gelato is perfect late at night and on the two days a year it's hot enough to sit out in Washington Square Park. I keep losing my free card, but I must've merited myself so free gelato by now. The people who work here seem to typically be exchange students, but sometimes the owners are staffing it -- all the employees are really friendly and very generous portion-wise. There's never a wait and the hours are really reasonable. Don't bother trying to park, though.
author: Mairead J.

description: It is GOOD STUFF. My favorite is chocolate peanut butter, but they've only got it certain days of the week. Has anybody figured out the flavor schedule? I heard that if you smile extra wide when you order, they'll throw one of those little gelato cookie wedges in for free. I like to grab a cup and eat it in the park. Make sure you get a green spoon. And don't forget to take a nappy.
author: Dave K.

description: I can't bring myself to ever order any other flavor than the coppamisto. It's so good! It's chocolate, vanilla and I think pistachio. I could be wrong about that last one inthe combo but it's just tasty! One day I just might try something else. One day, I tell you.
author: cyndi L.

description: good gelato...but ah...it really sucks to walk inside here in the summer....it's a hot, sticky and smelly sauna inside this little place....i don't get it..even with the doors open it get so hot in here...for such a tiny place...odd....but again....good gelato....
author: Hen A.

description:
for san francisco's crazy heat wave, gelato completed me. there's so many flavors. and he brought out the creme brulee when asked for. and thank goodness he did, cause it was delicious!

i would go back even with the sf fog!
author: Natalie B.

description: We had half Cookies and Cream and Coppa Mista. It was heavenly!! Definitely a great treat on the way down from Coit Tower or Washington Square day.
author: Angela Y.

description: Coppa Mista + Creme Brulee = Godhead.
author: Maximillian M.

description: Best decision ever to get some gelato at the North Beach Festival.  This place is great, it's homey with a friendly staff and great selection of gelato flavors.  Loved the pistachio/chocolate type flavor I got, didn't mix well with the pomegranate sorbet but I'm not complaining :).
author: Debbie Y.

description: Was craving some gelato today and stumbled upon this in North Beach. Ordered a small cup with a half of coconut and hazelnut with another half of banana with walnut. It was delicious and cute little place to grab some gelato.
author: Yan M.

description: The Pomegranate sorbetto is hands down the best within the San Francisco city limits. Its so fruity and tasty - all the taste and none of those pesky seeds!
author: Stacy T.

description: On a sunny day, mid 70's with no breeze (absolutely beautiful outside), the inside of this place was stuffy and overly warm. I can stand the heat but not stuffy. Couldn't wait to get back outside for fresh air. Since it was so warm inside, my gelato texture was a bit icy in certain places rather than the usual smooth sticky texture that we're all used to. With other gelato places nearby, I'd try somewhere else next time than to return here.
author: Sabi M.

description: Had a small half Creme Brulee half raspberry white chocolate. Very good, but for $3 a little pricey. I'll definitely be back to try some different flavors...
author: Nicolas H.

description: Consistently good.  If I feel like Gelato, I will endure the parking search to have it here.  The Dark Chocolate is amazing, and if you get them to mix pistachio with chocolate, it is good also.
author: Kapeli M.

description: Everytime I'm in North Beach and want some gelato, this is the place I go to.  The store is quite small and only has a couple small tables and chairs.  It tends to get a bit stuffy in the summer too.  So, I usually just order for a small cup with a  scoop of chocolate and a scoop of mocha gelato, walk over to the park and relax under the sun.
author: Ginni S.

description: We stumbled upon this place after a long night of drinking in north beach and right after eating a greasy phili cheesesteak sandwich.   There's a little couch for you to crash on as you try to sober up.   Some how gelato tastes so damn good with alcohol in your system!
author: Jeff H.

description: I don't ever write reviews if I have not had an opportunity to try the food.  Unfortunately, the service was so horrible here, I was unable to try the gelato, so I am writing this review anyway.  The girl behind the counter was counting the money.  No one else was in the shop.  I said, "Hi."  No response.  I perused the gelato choices.  Five minutes passed.  I said, "Are you still open?"  Maybe I had wasted five precious minutes choosing the Tiramisu gelato.  She looked over her shoulder, annoyed, and said something largely unintelligible.  I deciphered that potentially the shop was still open, but she was busy and I had interrupted her work.  I don't like it when people interrupt me when I am trying to count, so I could sort of understand her response.  But let's be honest.  Being non-responsive and dismissive at a gelato shop is an unpleasant experience.  Gelato shops are happy places, but unfortunately this woman was in a bad mood.  Maybe something happened to her today.  I will give her that.  But I also work in the service industry, and even when I've had a bad day, I put on a positive face, because that is my job.  The gelato looked good, so I wish the best of luck to others who try to purchase some gelato here.
author: esther r.

description: I would walk through a pride of starving lions, climb over an electric fence and swim across a river of piranhas to have the creamy deliciousness that is Gelato Classico. Can't wait for next fall when the pumpkin flavor comes back.
author: Fabian G.

description: My god!  The ice cream here is soooo good.  So creamy and delicious.  Only thing keeping me from coming here more often are the prices, which is a good thing or else I'd be fat as a house.
author: Doogie H.

description:
Gelato is okay. I don't think it is directly made here. They have a lot of chocolate selections. I think the gelateria on Columbus is much better. It's over-priced, like everything in SF.
But I'm more of a Pinkberry, non-fat fro-yo fan.
author: CaliforniaGrown R.

description: Have never been to Italy, but if the gelatos at Gelato Classico are any indication of what I'd find in Italy, then I'd catch the next flight out!!  Tried different flavors and all were great.  Great location in North Beach -- just grab a cone or cup and head to Washington Square park right around the corner for a delightul afternoon snack.
author: John c.

description: maybe it was because I had just gone to Bi-Rite the night before and immensely enjoyed the ice cream (coffee toffee & salted caramel, FYI).  yes, I know, gelato is not ice cream. but for the amount that I paid, I got a tiny cup. and it was too sweet for me. it's not terrible. but it's not mind bogglingly good either.
author: ray e.

description: I live a hop skip and jump away from North Beach yet for some reason I haven't spent much time here. But that is about to change since summer is here and we all know what that means...gelato! I first saw this place while dining at Cafe Divine a few weeks ago and remember thinking to myself that I would much rather have been eating gelato than eating whatever it was I was eating at the time. I suppose if you knew me well enough, you'd realize that I always would rather be eating gelato than doing the task at hand since ice cream is my true calling. In any event, today, being a rather hot one, seemed like a fitting day for some after work frozen delight. Taking the cable car over to Washington square park, a huge grin across my face (just thinking about ice cream makes me smile) you might have mistaken me for a tourist (minus the map and camera). Stepping inside the small yet charming shop, I was greeted by an extremely friendly girl at the counter who was patient enough to allow me to sample quite a few flavors before deciding on the final scoop. I ended up choosing the banana walnut and mango sorbet, stuffed nicely into a sugar cone. This rather small confection cost me a whopping $4.15. Now I don't mind paying $4.15 if I am getting a large, but come on, this was the smallest size they had, on a generic cone (not home made waffle or anything exciting). The gelato and sorbet was definitely tasty, the mango being particularly special. However, I don't think that it was worth the price but on this particular warm evening, it definitely hit the spot.
author: Kate A.

description: Damn good italian ice cream.  This has become my favorite spot to pick up ice cream, no matter what part of the city I'm coming from.  They have lots of good flavors to choose from...vanilla bean....cherry burgundy....tiramisu...orange creamsicle...but my favorite is my old standby, vanilla gelato and oreo cookies.  Creamy, rich, and delicious.  I'm getting excited just thinking about it....  The best part about this place is while they have great ice creams, I've also fallen in love with their sorbettos (aka sorbets).  I usually get half rasberry, half lemon, but I tasted the passion fruit the other night and I'll have to work that one in as well somehow.  The place is small with a couple of tables to sit down at inside, the owners are friendly enough, and it's located on the outskirts of the North Beach restaurants so it's never crowded (in my experience) and touristy-feeling.  Like I said, damn good italian ice cream.
author: LaSha G.

description: i loved the Bavarian mint, it was delicious, like eating Andes! the chocolate hazelnut was okay.  the perfect way to cool off from shopping. i gave it 4 stars cuz its cash only!
author: Jen P.

description: It was a beautiful day and what could be better than wandering North Beach with gelato in hand?  I popped into Gelato Classico for one of my favorite foods and although I had reservations - the gelato looked a little droopy - I ordered a small cup with dark chocolate peanut butter and Turkish coffee.  Hmm, it is rare that I find a gelato that disappoints, but this one did.  The temperature and texture were completely off (problem with refrigeration?) and it was a runny and not at all creamy.  It was very disappointing.
author: Lori G.

description: the gelato tastes so creamy and good! some choices are the traditional italien flavors,and then there's the spot of orange creamsicle. small place, but walk around north beach and enjoy! i love the coppa mista. mmmm.
author: Janelle H.

description: I've had ice cream in Italy- this is BETTER! It's the best ice creamin the universe!
author: Christine L.
